intro: Galium masferreri, commonly known as the Sierra Valley bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as streambanks and woodland areas. Galium masferreri is often found in the Sierra Nevada foothills and is adapted to the region's temperate climate.
